title: Fix WASM embed issues in beads v0.21.7 build
description: The ncruces/go-sqlite3 library has embedded WASM files that cause build failures with Go's embed directive in Guix. Need to either: 1) patch to exclude WASM embed, 2) properly handle embed files,  3) use build tags to exclude WASM, or 4) stay at v0.21.5

title: Package gopkg.in/yaml.v3 for Guix (if needed)
description: Beads v0.21.7 now requires gopkg.in/yaml.v3. Check if this already exists in Guix, as go-gopkg-in-yaml-v3 was found in search results.

title: Package go-github-com-ncruces-julianday for Guix
description: Dependency of ncruces/go-sqlite3. Required version: v1.0.0. URL: https://github.com/ncruces/julianday

title: Package go-github-com-ncruces-go-sqlite3 for Guix
description: Beads v0.21.6+ switched from modernc-org-sqlite to ncruces/go-sqlite3 for WASM support. Need to package this library for Guix before beads can be updated to 0.21.7. Package URL: https://github.com/ncruces/go-sqlite3 Required version: v0.29.1 or compatible

title: Create VM test environment for Cortex XDR Agent
description:
Create a complete Guix System configuration that can be tested in a VM:
- Include Cortex XDR Agent service configuration
- Provide step-by-step instructions for building VM image
- Document how to run and test the VM
- Include troubleshooting steps
- Test service startup, configuration, and basic functionality

title: Handle configuration file management for Cortex XDR
description:
Implement configuration file handling:
- cortex.conf in /etc/panw/ directory
- Configuration schema and validation
- Integration with Guix System configuration mechanism
- Allow users to specify configuration declaratively
- Ensure proper permissions and ownership
- Handle sensitive data (API keys, tenant info)

title: Create Shepherd service definitions for Cortex XDR Agent
description:
Create Guix Shepherd service definitions for the three Cortex XDR services:
- traps_trapsd.service (main agent service)
- traps_pmd.service (policy management daemon)
- traps_authorized.service (authorization service)

Include:
- Service dependencies and ordering
- Start/stop procedures
- Log file handling
- Auto-restart on failure
- Integration with Guix System configuration

title: Research and document Cortex XDR Agent architecture and requirements
description:
Read official documentation and gather information about:
- System requirements (kernel 2.6.32+, 4GB RAM, 10GB disk, x86_64)
- Dependencies (openssl 1.0.0+, ca-certificates, glibc)
- Installation locations (/opt/traps, /opt/traps/bin/cytool)
- Service architecture (trapsd, pmd, authorized services)
- Configuration requirements (/etc/panw/cortex.conf)
- Network requirements (outbound TCP 443)
- SELinux considerations

title: Package go-github-com-ncruces-sort for Guix
description: Dependency of ncruces/go-sqlite3. Required version: v0.1.6. URL: https://github.com/ncruces/sort

title: Package go-github-com-ncruces-wbt for Guix
description: Dependency of ncruces/go-sqlite3. Required version: v0.2.0. URL: https://github.com/ncruces/wbt

title: Update beads package from 0.21.5 to 0.21.7
description: Update the Guix package for beads to the latest upstream version 0.21.7. This includes updating version, hash, running style, build, and lint checks.

title: Obtain Cortex XDR Agent installer package
description: Download or obtain the Cortex XDR Agent for Linux installer package (RPM/DEB/Shell). Need to determine source: official Palo Alto Networks download, trial version, or client-provided package.

title: Document Cortex XDR Agent package usage
description:
Create user documentation:
- Installation instructions for Guix System
- Configuration examples
- Service management commands
- Troubleshooting guide
- Known limitations (e.g., kernel version requirements)
- Security considerations
- Example operating-system configuration snippet

title: Create a Guix package and a system service for the Cortex XDR Agent for Linux
description:
Create a complete Guix package for the Cortex XDR Agent for Linux, including system service configuration for automatic startup and management. This includes:
1. Research by reading https://docs-cortex.paloaltonetworks.com/r/Cortex-XDR/7.9/Cortex-XDR-Agent-Administrator-Guide/Introduction
2. Packaging the agent binary and handling dependencies
3. Creating service definition and ensuring proper integration with Guix System

title: Test Cortex XDR Agent package and service
description:
Test the complete package and service implementation:
- Package builds successfully with 'guix build'
- Service starts and stops correctly
- Agent communicates with Cortex XDR server
- Cytool utility works (/opt/traps/bin/cytool)
- Log files are created and rotated properly
- Agent survives system reboot
- Resource usage is acceptable
- Test on multiple kernel versions if possible

title: Create Guix package definition for Cortex XDR Agent
description:
Create the Guix package definition including:
- Package metadata (name, version, synopsis, description, license)
- Source handling (binary package extraction)
- Build phase customization
- Installation paths (/opt/traps)
- Runtime dependencies (openssl, ca-certificates, glibc)
- Patchelf for binary compatibility if needed
